channel.title: Is my computer on fire?
channel.description:
...I'm just joking about the title, but however, today I decided to try to get some information off an old Sata drive today. So, I opened my computer, plugged in the Hard drive to the power and to the Motherboard and and look over a little bit to see how my video card is doing and I'm like "Whatever, it looks good to me" So, I'm turning on the computer and I see all the fans spin. The CPU heatsink cooler, the powersupply one, the back one that lets out exhaust and an extra one I added. I see them all work except for one... I look at the video card and the fan was hanging from literally a cat hair or something :P. So, I touch the sink on the Video Card and my hand was literally burned. It hurt. So, I ran Speedfan and the readings were pretty bad...
Here they were: [IMG]http://i27.tinypic.com/4lvyc.png[/img]
Theeeeenn... After a few hours of resting my computer, going to Best Buy and buying a Video Card cooler, I installed it, (Removed my dial-up modem card :( ) and put it right below where the fan was. So, the fan now intakes air from the back of the computer and blows it in the same spot where the fan used to go. Also, earlier I got an error saying the Nvidia control panel shutdown and I was like :o Anyway here are the readings right now.
[IMG]http://i26.tinypic.com/avil1s.png[/img]
So, do you think this is a good temperature for casual web surfing right now for my video card?

item.title: Is my computer on fire?
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

today I decided to try to get some information off an old Sata drive today.

Fix that.

also, get a new fan or point a fan on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Is my computer on fire?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Which graphics card do you have? GPU’s run at high temperatures anyway so 72C is not too bad.

I have read a bit on pentium dual cores and 55C idle is a very high temperature for a 2Ghz machine. (My CPU which is famous for being fucking hot and runs at 3Ghz runs at the same temperature). Your fans must be poor in quality if they run at 3000rpm and still only get the CPU to 55C. I would first check if your CPU fan is mounted flat and tight then check if the thermal paste is ok. If there is nothing wrong with the placement or thermal paste then you should invest in a new CPU fan.

protip: bestbuy sucks, use newegg. (in US)

Read full topic
